title: Menzies' Home Movies
other_title: Menzies Home Movies Pre and Post Second World War Tours of England and Germany 1941 & 1948
abstract: These 16mm colour home movie film extracts, offer a rare glimpse into the life of Australia's longest serving Prime Minister, Robert Menzies.
description: After being given a 16mm camera by his good friend, George Nicholls, Sir Robert Menzies began filming home movies in 1941. The Menzies Home Movie Collection held in the National Film and Sound Archive includes approximately 35 films of varying duration and provides a unique opportunity to see the world through the eyes of an Australian Prime Minister as well as an historical record of Australian political life during the Second World War.
